contradicting_spans: Faria, since their first acquaintance, had been on all points so rational and logical, so wonderfully sagacious, in fact, that he could not understand how so much wisdom on all points could be allied with madness. Was Faria deceived as to his treasure, or was all the world deceived as to Faria?
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The excerpt contradicts the claim by suggesting that Faria is not mad, which implies that there is no evidence of a treasure.

analysis.claim_text: Aboard the prison transport he met Edmond Dantès’ father, heard tales of the merchant Pharaon and thus gained the first thread that later let him recognise the young sailor.

sub_claims.text: Aboard the prison transport he met Edmond Dantès’ father.
He heard tales of the merchant Pharaon.
